column3: 한양까지는 갈 길이 멀어요. \n긴 여행이 될 것 같네요.
column4: The road to Hanyang is far. It seems like it will be long journey.
column7: 한양까지는 갈 길이 멀어요. \n긴 여행이 될 것 같네요.
column8: The road to Hanyang is far. It seems like it will be long journey.

column4: How did you become a ghost?
About the person who you want to meet

column3: 음... 그게 말이죠… \n백마산에서 조금 남쪽에 있는 공동묘지 지역이에요.
column4: Well... It's the area of the communal cemetery, a little south of Baekma Mountain.
column7: 그분께선 우리 마을에 부임하셨던 사또의 자제분이셨어요.
column8: He was the son of the local magistrate in our village,

column3: ... 네, 한양에서 좀 더 멀어진 곳이에요.
column4: ... Yes, it's a bit farther from Hanyang.
column7: 늘 나라와 백성을 생각하는 훌륭한 선비이자, 저와는 사랑을 나누던 사이셨어요.
column8: He was a remarkable seonbi who always cared for the country and its people, and we shared a deep bond of love.

column3: 백마산에서 당신을 빼내는 과정에서, \n음기가 강한 이곳으로 이끌려 오게 되었나 봐요..
column4: It seems like during the process of rescuing you from Baekma Mountain, we ended up being led to this spiritually strong place...
column7: 하지만, 그분의 아버님께서 동승부지로 임명되어, 그분도 한양으로 떠나시게 되셨어요.
column8: However, their father was appointed to a capital, and he had to leave for Hanyang too.

column3: ... 뭐, 죽는 것보단 여행길이 멀어진 게 낫죠! \n불평하기 없기예요!
column4: ... Well, it's better to have a long journey than being dead! \nDon't complaints!
column7: 그분은 저에게 반드시 돌아오리라 약속하고 떠나셨죠...
column8: Before departing, he promised me that he would surely come back...

column3: ... 제가 죽던 날의 기억은 떠올리고 싶지 않네요.
column4: ... I don't want to recall the memories of the day I died.
column7: 저승으로 가기 전, 마지막으로 그분을 보고자 해요.
column8: Before journeying to the afterlife, I want to see him one last time.

column3: 욕심에 눈이 먼 사또에게 죽임을 당했다... \n정도로만 말씀드릴게요.
column4: In short, I was killed by the village magistrate, blinded by his own greed.
column7: 그 후엔, 더 이상 남은 미련은 없을 거예요...
column8: After that, I will have no lingering regrets...

column7: 변사또는 우리 마을에 새로 부임해온 마을 사또에요.
column8: Magistrate Byeon is the new local magistrate who came to our village.

column3: 아주 명석하셔서 큰 뜻을 품으신 분이면서도, \n높고 낮음에 연연치 않고 사람을 대하는 올곧은 분이죠.
column4: He is incredibly intelligent, carrying great aspirations, and treat people with fairness regardless of their status.
column7: 백성들의 고통은 아랑곳하지 않고, 자신의 욕심을 채우기 급급한 탐관오리였죠.
column8: He was a greedy and corrupt person interested only in fulfilling his own desires.

column3: 바라만 보아도 사람 좋게 만드는 분이시지만....
column4: Just the mere thought of him makes feel good...
column7: 그는 저에게 자신의 수발을 들 것을 강요했고...
column8: He demanded that I betray my principles,

column3: 전 이제 사람으로서 그분을 볼 순 없게 되었네요...
column4: But now, my human feelings are meaningless
column7: 제가 거절하자, 그는 저에게 모진 고문을 가하며, 끝내 저를 살해했어요.
column8: and when I refused, he subjected me to cruel torture, ultimately leading to my death.
